shortdesc.ph: Configures the built-in encryption mode and key.
Configures the built-in encryption mode and key.
Configures built-in encryption mode and key.
Configure built-in encryption mode and key.

plentry.pd: Built-in encryption mode. See . It is recommended to use Aes128Gcm2 or Aes256Gcm2 encryption modes. These modes support salt and offer higher security.

Built-in encryption key of type string with no length limit. A 32-byte key is recommended. If this parameter is not specified or set to , built-in encryption cannot be enabled and the SDK returns error code -2.

Salt with a length of 32 bytes. It is recommended to generate the salt on the server using OpenSSL. This parameter is effective only in Aes128Gcm2 or Aes256Gcm2 encryption modes. In this case, ensure the value of this parameter is not all 0.

Whether to enable data stream encryption:
: Enable data stream encryption.
: (Default) Disable data stream encryption.
Built-in encryption mode. See . It is recommended to use the Aes128Gcm2 or Aes256Gcm2 encryption modes. These modes support salt and offer better security.

Built-in encryption key, of type string, with no length limit. A 32-byte key is recommended. If this parameter is not specified or is set to , built-in encryption cannot be enabled, and the SDK returns error code -2.

Salt, 32 bytes in length. It is recommended to generate the salt on the server side using OpenSSL. This parameter takes effect only when the encryption mode is Aes128Gcm2 or Aes256Gcm2. In this case, make sure the value of this parameter is not all 0.

Whether to enable data stream encryption:
: Enable data stream encryption.
: (default) Disable data stream encryption.
Built-in encryption mode. See . It is recommended to use aes128Gcm2 or aes256Gcm2 encryption modes. These two modes support salt and offer higher security.

Built-in encryption key, of type String, with no length limit. It is recommended to use a 32-byte key. If this parameter is not specified or set to NULL, built-in encryption cannot be enabled, and the SDK returns error code -2.

Salt, 32 bytes in length. It is recommended to generate the salt on the server side using OpenSSL. This parameter takes effect only when using aes128Gcm2 or aes256Gcm2 encryption modes. In this case, ensure that the value provided for this parameter is not all 0.

Whether to enable data stream encryption:
: Enable data stream encryption.
: (Default) Disable data stream encryption.
Built-in encryption mode. See . It is recommended to use AES_128_GCM2 or AES_256_GCM2 modes, which support salt and offer higher security.

Built-in encryption key, string type, no length limit. It is recommended to use a 32-byte key. If this parameter is not specified or is set to NULL, built-in encryption cannot be enabled and the SDK returns error code -2.

Salt, 32 bytes in length. It is recommended to generate the salt on the server using OpenSSL. This parameter takes effect only when using AES_128_GCM2 or AES_256_GCM2 encryption modes. In this case, ensure the value of this parameter is not all 0.

Whether to enable data stream encryption:
: Enable data stream encryption.
: (default) Disable data stream encryption.
